message.content: This question requires understanding of basic physics concepts, specifically buoyancy. When the mother sprays more water into the pool, the water level rises, which causes the boat to also rise with the water. Option (A) is incorrect because the boat does not fly, as it is still in the water. Option (B) is also incorrect because the boat does not actually swim, but rather floats on the water. Option (C) is untrue as drowning refers to a living organism suffocating in water, which does not apply to an inanimate object like a toy boat.

This question requires an understanding of basic physics and the principles of buoyancy. When water is added to the pool, the level of water rises. The boat is floating on the surface of the water, so as the water level rises, the boat will also rise with the water. Therefore, option (D) is the correct answer. Option (A) is incorrect because the boat does not have the ability to fly. Option (B) is incorrect because the boat is not actively swimming, it is passively floating. Option (C) is incorrect because the boat does not sink or drown in the water.

This question requires an understanding of the basic principles of buoyancy. When more water is added to the pool, the water level rises, which will cause the boat to rise as well. This is because the boat displaces an amount of water equal to its weight, and as more water is added to the pool, the buoyant force on the boat increases, causing it to rise. Option (A) is incorrect because the boat does not have wings to fly. Option (B) is incorrect because the boat is an inanimate object and cannot actively swim. Option (C) is incorrect because drowning is a term used for living organisms in water and does not apply to an inanimate object like a toy boat.

Option (C) is untrue because the boat does not drown as it is not a living organism.
